channel.title: Blogs on Catherine Blatter
channel.description: Recent content in Blogs on Catherine Blatter

item.title: Importing Datasets with Swiss/German specifics: umlaut
item.description: This blog post is part of the ongoing collection Data preparation series. It collects hints for preparation of data by some of the ongoing multi-center projcets at the Institute of Nursing Science. Why is this needed? Many ongoing projects at INS are multi-center studies combining both survey- and routinely collected data Most of them have data coming from at least two different language regions (German- and French-speaking, eventually Italian-speaking)

item.title: Getting PubMed metadata with RISmed directly into RStudio
item.description: What is this post about? Introduction - what were the problems I faced? RISmed package How to use RISmed? How could my thesis profit from the RISmed package? item.title: Useful hints for Endnote
item.description: ðŸ’¡ A collection of hints for working with Endnote this is a working document primarily addressed at students from the Institute of Nursing Science at University of Basel and may change over time - feedback welcome What is this document and why? Endnote is the citation manager proclaimed in many courses at the INS. Over the past years Iâ€™ve encountered a number of struggles personally or through my peers. This document lists the major problems Iâ€™ve seen and offers solutions that worked for me.
